title: 7 Different Ways to Get Free WiFi at Home

steps.title: Your phone network can provide WiFi to other devices.
steps.content: Your phone network can provide WiFi to other devices. Head into your settings and click on “Hotspot,” then enable it. Set up a password and use it to connect to WiFi on your tablet or your computer . Keep in mind that a hotspot uses cellular data—if you don’t have an unlimited amount, you could run out. [1] X Research source If you only need to use a hotspot on one device, use a USB cable to tether your phone to your computer or tablet. Then, turn on your hotspot, but choose “ tethering ” instead of Bluetooth.

steps.title: Low income homes may qualify for free WiFi through this program.
steps.content: Low income homes may qualify for free WiFi through this program. Head to their website and enter in your zip code and how much you make in a single year. If you’re eligible, you can submit an application to get free WiFi through one of the internet providers in your area. [2] X Research source To see if you’re eligible, visit https://www.everyoneon.org/find-offers and enter your zip code.

steps.title: This company offers free WiFi for 60 days.
steps.content: This company offers free WiFi for 60 days. If you don’t have a Comcast account already, you can call and sign up for 2 free months of WiFi. After that, you can either cancel your account or sign up for a paid subscription. [3] X Trustworthy Source State of New York Official website for the State of New York Go to source To sign up for Comcast, visit https://corporate.comcast.com/press/releases/comcast-extends-free-internet-service-new-internet-essentials-customers .

steps.title: If you’re a student, you can get free WiFi for 60 days.
steps.content: If you’re a student, you can get free WiFi for 60 days. Head to their website to see if you’re eligible, then call a service provider to sign up. After 2 months, you can either cancel your subscription or sign up for a paid account. [4] X Research source To see if you’re eligible, visit https://www.alticeusa.com/news/articles/feature/corporate/altice-usa-brings-free-broadband-k-12-and-college-students-during-coronavirus-pandemic .

steps.title: The Verizon Lifeline program offers free WiFi to low income households.
steps.content: The Verizon Lifeline program offers free WiFi to low income households. Head to their website and fill out an application to see if you’re eligible. If you are, you can then call Verizon and get started on a free Lifeline account. [5] X Research source To see if you qualify, visit https://www.verizon.com/support/residential/account/manage-account/lifeline-discount .

steps.title: If you have a K-12 student, you may qualify for 2 free months.
steps.content: If you have a K-12 student, you may qualify for 2 free months. Head to the Cox website and enter in your location and how much you make to get started. If you have a child in the home who is still in school, Cox will provide you with 60 days of free WiFi. To start your application, visit https://www.cox.com/residential-shop/wls/order-cox-services.html .

steps.title: Your neighborhood can give you access to free WiFi.
steps.content: Your neighborhood can give you access to free WiFi. Head over to a neighbor’s house and ask them if you can use their WiFi. They might not agree, but if they do, you can use their password to connect to their network. [6] X Research source If any of the WiFi networks nearby your home are unlocked (meaning they don’t have a password), click on them and try to connect. You never know—you might just find your new WiFi hub right from your home!
